Title: "Good Pros, Questionable Cons"
Pros:
Getting meals for free from them, every day you go to work.
You are given discounts at an online website which will have some offers you might use
College Tuition Reimbursement (You must work for a Year at Chipotle though)
Uniform Shirt and Hat are Free (Not the work shoes though)
Cons:
For those who want me to go straight to the point: Chipotle is not a job to goof off. There will be a lot expected of you, so be ready to be on your feet, as those benefits they offer you do come with a price. Be fast, be perfect, or you're not a "Top Performer".

And real quick, in the food industry, you're going to deal with customers. They will test your patience, so hope you are already good with that. With that said, here's the con of Chipotle:

There's going to be many things the restaurant will teach you, and want you to to know and remember. And the main one you will hear is you becoming a "Top Performer". The definition of this is that you are supposed to help out your fellow Co-workers and elevate them to become, well, "Top Performers", the best workers so you guys can be efficient at your job.
-In reality its you going back and forth on two positions and trying your best to accomplish both. This becomes especially hard when the lunch rush hits.
An example will be being on Cash, and while that alone has some tasks for you to do (Like taking all orders, cleaning the dining room and bathroom), you must also help out the burrito station when customers are coming in. And now keep doing that at a quicker pace when the lunch rush comes in, and you're attempting to help your co-worker with the many customers he has on the Burrito station, while taking orders on the phone and gathering the Online Orders, AND having to help the customers who come to the Cash Register to get their online order.
Oh and once that's done you are told by your boss that the dining room is dirty, why didn't you do anything about it.

This was my first job, but from my understanding I thought that a person was assigned a job, and they had certain tasks they must do. A Janitor Cleans, A Cashier tends the customers, and a server makes the burritos. But Chipotle will make you be all 3 and slap on "top performer" to give it a valid excuse for you to do these. And even then I was forgiving, and do these tasks anyways. But what doesn't make up is the extra time I stay at work to finish the tasks that aren't necessarily mine, and the lectures I get that task X is not done correctly, when I had tasks A, B, C, D, E, F, G that they THEMSELVES told me to do as well. It's silly how they expect everything to be done fast, and without mistake.

I would like to say maybe it was simply my bad luck, that by chance it was just the location of my restaurant which made the tasks difficult (Mine was near a Baseball Stadium, as well as a train station in which many commute to and from work). But no matter what the location is, work is work, and Chipotle will be sure you are indeed doing just that, by making you work, and work fast in the Food Industry.
Advice to Management: You got nice benefits that attract people such as College Students, but from my restaurant I seen many leave soon after. I understand that work is work, and shouldn't be challenging at times, but the "top performer" and the method used for lunch rushes should be revised and adjusted. You don't know how many times we have 6 people standing in the front doing nothing cause its "rush" and once its over we are swarmed with people but Oh, rush is over so its up to the 2 guys at Tortilla to figure it out. Not good, not encouraging.

Title: "Cashier/Front Line"
Pros: AWESOME people to work with. My shift manager was so chill and relaxed, he kept motivating us to push through the lunch and dinner crowds. In between, he would give us packs on the back and water to make sure we were all hydrated (esp. the front line cooks!)
Cons: The lunch crowd is absolutely awful! There are so many people and so little time to serve. At one point, I felt as if I was a robot dumping food into those little trays.
Advice to Management: There's not really anything to say about management since my manager did whatever he could to make sure we were a smooth functioning team. He's the best.

Title: "Great Opportunities"
Pros: Great Benefits, Fun environment, Great Culture
Cons: No cons at all, great job for students

Title: "Messy messy! STAY AWAY!"
Pros:
Free food
Cash tips after every shift
Reasonable hours considering I was in school
Uniform isn't too crazy
Cons:
Favoritism
Gossip/drama
Late hours
Snooty customers
Language barrier. (If you didn't speak Spanish you were basically talked about & ignored by management)
Poor pay rate
Advice to Management: Get it together. Y'all are so petty it's ridiculous. & Telling someone to write in their development journal for personal growth to turn around & use that as ammo to FIRE them for it is a very unethical & just pathetic business practice. Grow up!

Title: "Great enviornment"
Pros: Everyone is passionate about their job
Cons:
hard work
always short staffed
long days
Advice to Management: hire more

Title: "CASH"
Pros: Free Food on shift, 50% off menu items while not working.
Cons: They believe in making everyone a manager. Kitchen managers,Service Managers,etc. Communication needs to be improved on. The store i worked at barley had any business. Employees spend to much time on thier phones. No one wants to do thier share of the work.
Advice to Management: Listen to your employees.

Title: "Not a great job"
Pros: Free meal every single shift.
Cons: They expect way too much of you and I found out my manager was a drug dealer.

Title: "Mixed views"
Pros: Assuming you're under good management (GM) people are willing to work together and help each other out to make the restaurant a great environment for both the crew and the customer. It feels less of a task and becomes enjoyable.
Cons: Having worked at 4 different locations I was (un)fortunate to see the downsides. For instance if the GM is not very knowledgeable the whole restaurant suffers. Due from the lack of leadership the crew starts slacking off which puts a lot of stress on the other managers along with the hard working crew trying to pick up slack.
Advice to Management: Field leaders need to be more attentive in struggling restaurants and helping the GM improve the restaurant rather than putting the main focus on already good restaurants.

Title: "5 year employee"
Pros: Free food, flexible schedule, performance reviews
Cons: low raises $0.10-$0.25, no growth
Advice to Management: award your employees fairly, really execute developing future leaders, allow crew meetings for AM and PM shifts.

Title: "over the top mission statements that will have you believe that rolling burritos is like saving lives"
Pros: Free burritos and Soda. Learn some knife skills. Fast pace work if your into that kind of stuff. Did I mention free burritos?
Cons: Little to no benefits unless you make it to general manager. Low pay. Low tips. This a great job for students.
Advice to Management: You will be expected to do a lot with very little but don't wear yourself to thin. Use your people.

Title: "Great company with excellent care for their employees!"
Pros: Great people, great food, great company. Chipotle stands for a lot of great ideals, and they take great care of their employees. They have a lot of benefits (like tuition reimbursement), and give free food! I survive on my free entree a shift, and 50% off anytime. Amazing company.
Cons: This job is fast paced and high stress. This job requires patience because many people can be rude or slow.
Advice to Management: Continue to invest in your employees! We will invest more in Chipotle in response. Thank you for your care for your crew.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: free food, and greta employee discout
Cons: the people, co workers, the schedule

Title: "Good experience"
Pros:
- Positive Culture
- Good pay
Cons:
- Long Hours
- Inconvient hours

Title: "High stress"
Pros: Free meals, career path, decent pay
Cons: Long hours, never ending expectation list, biased higher up's, unrealistic expectations
Advice to Management: Refocus back to when people development was important. Stop looking at everyone as replaceable.

Title: "Agony at Chipotle (specially the Delmar loop location in Missouri)"
Pros: You learn alot of culinary skills you wouldnt learn at any other restaurant.
Cons:
They don't have a training program that works.
There isn't any room to grow for management.
I came in with 3+ plus years of shift supervisor experience, and my starting pay was 9.00. Which was a $3 deficit from what i was making as manager.
Scheduling sucks. The location i was at didnt really believe in scheduling people properly per shift.
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Free food, horrible treatment"
Pros:
Free food
Paid 10/hr
Worked with school schedule
Cons:
Didnt care about workers
Management Shakey
Broken promises by management.
Overworked team members
No teamwork
Advice to Management: If your employee has severe burns on ankle please listen.

Title: "Have had the chance to work with many people with potential for greatness. Some rise to the challenge, others fade away."
Pros: Free meals that you and your coworkers have hand-made. Diet-restrictive options. Opportunity to work with amazing people who want to accomplish something, be the best, support a team, or change the world. Sincere camaraderie. Great resources for learning and mastering.
Cons: Intense pressure to be perfect or to follow every procedure or ensure every standard to the letter. Frustrating when team support is lacking. People who interview well slip through and clearly do not have what it takes to be successful or to help you be successful, but are continually invested in. Great vision at the top: inspiring, clear, focused. Yet, this is impractical among numbers-minded field leadership. Inconsistent and ineffective leadership training. Must learn as one goes.
Advice to Management: Stay focused and consistent. Choose one or two things you want to have in your restaurant and start from there. Don't let the image of restaurateur immobilize you or the disappointment among the crew distract you. For the sake of the team, be consistent. In addition, be honest. If you're not going to get somewhere, step down and let someone else do it. And be vulnerable while not complaining. Tell people how much you work and don't let anyone walk over you.

Title: "Good, hard work"
Pros: Great crew and managers, fun environment, free food.
Cons: Hard work, 16+ hour shifts, 50 hours a week, occasional bad management decisions, bad schedule.
Advice to Management: Get the schedule out by Wednesday at the latest. Sunday night at 6pm doesn't cut it.

Title: "service manager review (3 years employed)"
Pros: Awesome place to work if you have all 13 Characteristics that they want from you and you can handle a fast pace atmosphere and demanding schedule full time .Chipotle is what you make of it.
Cons: Your success depends on how strong your management team is. Some locations managers lack enthusiasm and consistent effort to elevating the team .. over all amazing company. But some GM's lose drive and neglect top performers. End result a BIG turn out of rotating crews all around.
Advice to Management: Depends on area. Not all areas are ran tight knit. Chipotle has a high rate of promotions from crew member fast tracked towards management . Depends on how driven you are if can stick in for the process of it.

Title: "Chipotle worker"
Pros: Fast paced environment requiring great focus and dedication
Cons: Customers are often difficult to please
Advice to Management: Provide more training and guidance to employees

Title: "Hard work"
Pros: Flexible schedule, good pay .
Cons: Hardly any time , constant schedule change .

Title: "Get it together. Please!"
Pros: Free tasty lunch each shift worked (at least 6 hours), cool customers, some (and I do mean SOME) nice co-workers, above minimum wage pay.
Cons: Weasel-liars among the team members, incompetent GM, Respectful Workplace line is a joke, termination with no due notice or discussion, illogical expectations after only a short time in the restaurant.
Advice to Management: Please take more care for training your Apprentices and General Managers, as this location was completely reprehensible. And I do believe termination without notice is illegal? I'll be following up with that. No one ever answers the Respectful Workplace line, and when someone does get around to reaching back out to you, nothing gets done still. It's completely hilarious that the GM running this location thinks he should be at Restaurateur by next month! Funny how this company boasts "Food with integrity" but its employees' integrity is nonexistent. I felt welcomed during orientation and the first couple of days there. After that, I distinctly felt the vibes of my team members resemble that of them not really wanting me there anymore, so I guess it was a team effort to get me out of the door with reporting untruths to the incompetent GM. Congrats! I also won't be returning to eat here either. The food tastes inconsistent now, probably because they can't keep anyone in there, save for the Weasel-liars. Whole lot of work needing to be done at this location!

Title: "Great job for a beginner"
Pros: Grea friendlybpeople worker great things
Cons: Nothing really it was aweomsee

Title: "It's a good job but expect this."
Pros:
You get a paid lunch
$1.50 more than minimum wage
Good Benefits
Cons:
A lot of work
Expect to clean a lot
You cannot use loopholes
Fast pace
Some general manager don't deserve to be one.
Advice to Management: Please work with people schedules

Title: "Eh"
Pros: Great coworkers, they felt like family. Company has ok benefits, and tuition reimbursements. Have bought groceries only a handful of times while working here, a lot of free food.
Cons: Very understaffed. Unfairly high expectations for a fast food job with the war given. Very* stressful, high owed work environment.

Title: "Amazing culture-poor management choices"
Pros: I love this company and everything they believe in. Their goal is to promote from within as quickly as possible and give inexperienced people a chance at a career doing something they are passionate about.
Cons: Some general managers should not have been promoted to this position as they have no idea what they are doing. Others are amazing but the few that sneak by really ruin your experience.
Advice to Management: Watch who you are promoting. It gets tiring hearing that you regret making someone GM and wish you could get them out.

Title: "cashier"
Pros:
free food when working
1/2 off when off
tuition reimbursement
hours
friendly people
Cons:
really busy
long hours
people complaining
prep work
customers

Title: "Depends On Situation"
Pros: great people, great values, free food
Cons: have strayed from company principles
Advice to Management: make sure field leaders aren't playing politics and are choosing the right people to lead, or else things will continue to spiral downward.

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: They Really Care about you as a person and want to see you develop. Chance to move up fast and start a career as a GM in 1-2 years.
Cons: Constantly will be losing employees and training new ones. Can be a stressful work environment depending on what team you have.
Advice to Management: Continue To inspire with the vision and actually care about your employees. DJ's and One on Ones are way more important then you will ever imagine. They can literally inspire and motivate a crew member and they will work extremely hard.

Title: "Sucks"
Pros: They have nice people that work here at the Chipotle. Friendly customers most of the day.
Cons: Low pay, cut my hours randomly, fake motivational work environment, chance to advance is based on co-workers liking you.
Advice to Management: Don't cut people's hours.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: The best part is the people
Cons: They overwork everyone. Mantors micromanage everything and are not trusting you to do your job

Title: "Part-time cashier"
Pros: Benefits are great you get medical, dental and vision. Depending on where you work, you'll have amazing coworkers.
Cons:
Health benefits come out of check.
Part-time pretty much forced to work full-time because they don't care about your schedule.
Advice to Management: Respect your employees schedule. Be fair, if I can't come in late then others shouldn't be able too come in late. Properly train employees, whether it be a full day or a week, make sure the employee knows what they are doing.

Title: "cook"
Pros: i enjoyed the free food
Cons: too stressful because employees are overworked
Advice to Management: be understanding. stop being arrogant

Title: "Too much hype, too little support."
Pros: Employee meals. High paced environment helps the time go by, most people want to work hard. A lot of the prep work is fun or rewarding.
Cons: Managers can promise too much. Chipotle from a corporate standpoint wants unrealistic standards but wont let the GMs staff their stores properly.
Advice to Management: My advice would be to stop hiring the wrong people, and stop letting the right people (top performers) go.

Title: "Great experience"
Pros: Free food , and the chance to work with amazing people.
Cons: The hours weren't as flexible so some times I would barely get hours

Title: "If i were you I wouldnt work for chipotle"
Pros: I really liked all of my co-workers while working for Chipotle. They offer free food on the days that you work, which was nice.
Cons: They tell you that hours are flexible but when you tell them your available hours they complain or ignore your hours and schedule you when they know you cant work. They did not work with me very well when my availability would change for school. The work load is ridiculous and not enough time is giving for some tasks. Overall, the management was very low performing.
Advice to Management: Maybe be more flexible with your people? In hours, in time given for a task, everything. Stop telling people your willing to be flexible with hours when you really are not.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: Great place to grow from crew to manager. Allows for mistakes to shape experiences to become a top performer.
Cons: I did not receive full training for any position. Up from crew to management. I was a "thrown in the deep end" philosophy and I was one of the lucky ones that swam.
Advice to Management: Listen to crew from below. Empowerment is one of the building blocks for the companies success.

Title: "Not a bad job"
Pros: Fun crew, great benefits for full-time employees
Cons: None really. Some of the lateral management moves can disrupt workplace culture and flow.
Advice to Management: Keep the strong crew happy, and balance work evenly.

Title: "Hard work but great company."
Pros: Fast paced. A lot of emphasis on moving up in the company. Very possible to do well with them.
Cons: Crazy hard work with little breaks.
Advice to Management: Listen to the need of the employees.

Title: "Awesome."
Pros: Really fast paced. You alwaya have something to do! Plus you get 50% off when you are off & free meals during shift.
Cons: Manager is nit the nicest.
Advice to Management: Teacher managers to manage and be nice at the same time. You don't have to go around biting everyones head.. People will like the job but hate management in which they wont want to work there.

Title: "It's a great job"
Pros: Friendly team members, very nice managers that help you when they can, good benefits, and they are willing to work with your college schedule.
Cons: Things get really hectic around lunch hour, things are very rushed in opening and closing, and it can get stressful fast.

Title: "Hard Work and Burritos"
Pros:
Great sociable crew and managers
Awesome company culture that promotes from within, giving anybody who hustles a chance to move up
Always fast paced, never a dull moment
Chipotle now helps pay for school with reimbursements
Cons:
Work/ Life balance is nearly nonexistence when you're an involved crew member or higher
Fast paced, could be a con for those who's looking for a lax job
Advice to Management:
Focus on keeping a pipeline of managers going
Care for your crew and try hard not to overwork them

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Free meal during shift, flexible schedule, team work, opportunity to grow, high standards. Overtime is usually unheard of at other food jobs (I'd go home before going into overtime) but they give it if you stay extra and there was no rush to make you finish fast.
Cons: Hard work if you're on grill, lots to prep in the morning, tiny fryer for making chips, heavy rice cookers, you definitely smell like barbacoa when you're off.
Advice to Management: Great company overall!

Title: "Chipotle Crew Worker"
Pros: The food is very ethical and all the ingredients are fresh and as local as possible. High starting pay.
Cons: Constantly being expected to stay an hour after you were supposed to get off, and if you don't you aren't a "top performer". In the morning, never getting longer than a 10 minute break, even on a 9 hour shift. The concept of elevation is passive aggressive.

Title: "Potential for success, but at what cost?"
Pros:
College credits for mgmt training
Great benefits
You really can go from crew to manager (I went from crew to GM in 3 years with no former experience or degree)
Lots of knowledge to be gained
Cons:
Expectations are sometimes unrealistic
Things have changed and it's hard to stay inspired
It can be a very hard job
Finding the right people can be very difficult
Depending on your position, this job will consume your life
Your experience completely depends on upper management in your area
Advice to Management: Stop opening new stores and focus on the older ones that are understaffed and falling apart but making 3 times as much money than the new stores

Title: "Wouldn't Work Here If You're a College Student"
Pros: Teaches you great customer service, organization, free meal any shift you work
Cons: Horrible for student workers, don't work with you, constantly called in, fire a lot of people
Advice to Management: Quit playing favorites and being lazy

Title: "A great learning experience"
Pros: Great learning experience, a great way to learn how to market and build people culture with your team. The company work with local farmers and is doing things the right way, chipotle goes that extra mile for they customer rather then any other fast food place !
Cons: If they wrong people are on your team it makes the job harder, there's no cons to this place everything we do we are doing to better the future and our children

Title: "Team Member"
Pros: Free food during your shift, lenient hours that worked very well with my class schedule. They will also reimburse some of your tuition but you have to work for a full year first.
Cons: Management always had something to criticize, to the point where they started contradicting one another. One manager would tell me one thing, I'd start performing the way that manager wanted me to, and another would come and tell me it's all wrong. Some of them are VERY serious about scooping too, which got to be ridiculous.
Advice to Management: Communicate one another more to get rid of discrepancies in training styles. It's more frustrating on the employees to be repeatedly corrected or criticized.

Title: "Its fun"
Pros: Its a fast paced environment, you get a free meal everyday, full benefits, vacations also you can get 401k...
Cons:
Its changing alot constantly so ull have to adapt fast, they promise a lot and deliver short.
It can be stressful sometimes

Title: "Great Environment"
Pros: Great customers and employees to be around.
Cons: Everything moves extremely fast during rush hour.
Advice to Management: Keep up the positive attitude. Very encouraging.

Title: "Hard work, but the people are awesome"
Pros: The managers are all so nice. You learn so much at life, how to be a better person, and how to be faster
Cons: It is a lot of work, very tiring. They always want you to become faster. But once again you learn so much

Title: "Fair pay, good work"
Pros: They pay their employees above minimum wage. Management at my branch was excellent, good training, and free food was a nice perk.
Cons: Management isn't always consistent, have worked at other branches that weren't run as well as this one.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros:
- connection between coworkers
- free food on shift, 50% off , off shift
Cons: - if fired, you cant apply to anny other chipotle ever
Advice to Management: One of the 13 characteristics are " Honesty" therefore dont lead people on during an interview making them believe they have such a good shot and pull the line " well contact you " if you say so, then be a person of your word and do so, even if its someone simple as a " were sorry but we cannot hire you" .

Title: "Cashier"
Pros:
-Meeting new people.
-Food is good.
-Room to grow within the company.
Cons:
-Having to stay hours later after your scheduled shift.
-People leave the company often.
Advice to Management: Try to get more help and not worry so much about budget. That seems to be why people leave.

Title: "crew"
Pros:
Free food. Possibility to move up and build a career. Great crew at least at my location.
Manager are good but depends on your location as well not every chipotle is the same.
good food safety procedures for high quality. Great experience and team work.
Cons: people from the back of the house don't get paid extra online on management position and others. But overall is a good corporation that has its little problems like any other places would.

Title: "Area Manager"
Pros: Great people with strong work ethics.
Cons: Long hours for salaried employees.
Advice to Management: You must be passionate about food.

Title: "Apprentice Review"
Pros: great benefits, pay, opportunities to grow and advance in the company. one free meal per shift.
Cons: be expected to work 60 plus hours a week. The company heavily relies on you to stay with the company. too much expectation from the higher ups.

Title: "good but tough"
Pros: I like working here, the people are great, we're pushed to be better workers, definitely helped me grow as a worker and as a person. You'll most likely work with other young people which makes it fun, everyone is very friendly and will be glad to help you with anything. lots of room for growing and moving up.
Cons: It is demanding work, specially in high volume stores. You have to deal with completing multiple tasks in short amounts of time, if you're not prepared for it it WILL stress you out A LOT. Working with lots of other young people can also mean that sometimes people still act like this is high school and will cause drama. Communicate firmly and openly with workers and managers to avoid situations like that.
Advice to Management: Work more on communication, and don't try too hard to be best friends with all your employees; you're our bosses, not our BFF's

Title: "Apprentice"
Pros: Climbed up, dedication, fun at times
Cons: Stressful, overwhelming, no free time

Title: "Crew member-Prep/Grill"
Pros: they have great management, they care about you, you get free food, and they value your work so work hard you will move up.
Cons: Sometime you have a lot of things to do the require more time that you don't have.
Advice to Management: keep up the good work

Title: "Good"
Pros: The work environment is really good and people are willing to help you learn and grow
Cons:
Too much work to do
You must be very fast, you can't even take a 5 minutes break

Title: "Chipotle experience"
Pros: Free meals, meet new people, gain work experience, learn a little bit of everything
Cons: No Union, employees tend to be nit-picky, very negative place to work at, advancement is more so random and predicated off social position , and 40% work ethic.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Pros are flexible work hours and very family oriented. They worked with me to incorporate my schooling.
Cons: Sometime there was not enough staff on hand so it would be overwhelming trying to do multiple jobs at once
Advice to Management: Really get to know each store and adjust workers hours around the days and peak times.

Title: "Overall great work experience but not for long term"
Pros: They're incredible about teaching people new skills, treating their employees with respect, and having a team-based environment.
Cons: The pay is fairly lacking, like most chain restaurants. There's also an unrealistic expectation to work off the clock or unpaid overtime.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Some of the best reasons to work at Chipotle are because of the challenging work environment. You and your co-workers challenge and make one another better on a daily basis making it an environment the betters you mentally.
Cons: Some downside are having a different schedule every week. Closing can also result in nights that go as long as 2am. Also 9 times out of 10 you never get off on time because of certain inconveniences and the overall quality of the team. Hard workers have to take the load of what others may lack on quote on quote team environments.
Advice to Management: Management may need to put their selves in the shoes of the workers in order to understand how to best help their workers be in the best position to fulfill and carry out their daily duties. Almost everyone I know is afraid to lose their jobs no matter how far they get. It doesn't seem like a job individuals can be in for the long term.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros:
-many opportunities for advancement within the company
-team environment
-experience i largely depended on the people you work with
Cons:
-long hours, if you close the store, you could be there until 2am
-I worked there as a college student par time, management encouraged me to quit school to devote myself to Chiptole full time

Title: "Part time work at Chipoltle"
Pros:
- The free food is much higher quality than a lot of fast food places and is actually a really nice benefit
- The job is usually kept interesting
Cons: - Many times I felt like too much was expected of me, given that I was working for just slightly over minimum wage. Managers would often tell me I need to be quicker. Overall not too bad though, you get better at doing stuff eventually.
Advice to Management: Be a little more relaxed with your employees, and in general give them some cushion so they do not consistently have to work at max pace just to complete what is needed

Title: "salsa prep"
Pros: High standards. Strive for perfection. opportunities to advance.
Cons: Competitiveness for management positions causes a lot of drama. Managers are like teenagers given authority positions.
Advice to Management: Be more professional

Title: "Working isn't too bad to eat"
Pros: Free lunch on your breaks
Cons: Minimum wage job, very busy work

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Great culture, teach great skills, advancement
Cons: They have a great culture but very rarely is it reached. Work you way too hard for low pay but if you stay long enoughand work hard you will move up. Hires way too many kids and this hurts the overall vision of the company

Title: "employee"
Pros: Free and 50% off food, growth opportunity, learning experience, met great friends
Cons: Corporate is very tough and strict. Every few weeks, we would have district managers come in and question us about really dumb things. Some of the district managers were really stuck up like they were better than everyone.
Advice to Management: listen to employees more, rather than corporate

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Some of the crew members were fun and had great personality, you got a free meal and a paid break, it was around different colleges and high school so we had interesting customers, you get to learn how to work line, cash and grill.
Cons: They only teach you a little bit of what you need to learn then they just throw you there with no real training, the managers don't really communicate well with the crew members and they treat you like theirs slaves if you were late you got punish instead of sent home,you always end up staying later then you originally where schedule for. They get attitude and fire crew members for anything then complain that they don't have enough crew members, they wanted to built a team of top performers but it was impossible to built a team if your hire a bunch of new crew every other month and fire the old ones. They don't care about your life or hobbies, if you don't dedicate yourself to chipotle and would not sacrifice your life for it then your instantly fired. I was suppose to work only part time but ended up closing 6 nights a week. I saw general managers and others managers get thrown under the bus every few months they would either quit from all the stress or get fired cause top boss felt like they weren't dedicated enough. They treat you like crap.
Advice to Management: Communicate and try to understand your crew members you can't get restauranteur if your an rude to everyone and act like a dictator.

Title: "Working at chipotle was fun"
Pros:
-Free food
-Discounts on second meal
- Great co workers
Cons:
- Short Breaks
- Favortisim
- Managers didnt make food schedules for students who still went to school
Advice to Management: Stop it with the favoritism

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: You get to meet new people every dia and make them have a great experience
Cons: That they made me feel like I didn't matter
Advice to Management: To care more about the people who they have working with

Title: "Greatest possible company!"
Pros: You will always be surrounded by a overwhelmingly supportive staff! Company and its beliefs are amazing and you will have everything you need (benefits and such) while getting endless chances to advance in the company!
Cons: Lots of work but definitely worth it! If you have an already busy schedule, such as school, I would REALLY think about whether this job is for you or not depending on the hours you are offered because this company is exactly like being back in school
Advice to Management: Keep up the great work and continue the effort you put into keeping in touch with our bother personally and professionally. You are helping us grow more than you know, heres the recognition you deserve!

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: Great place to work as long as you get along with coworkers
Cons: Favoritism amongst the managers was common

Title: "Great career advancements"
Pros: Free meals when working, 50% off all the time, easy to move up to manager, raises every 6 months
Cons: Not a lot of hours

Title: "A lot of work, but good starting pay"
Pros: Free food after shift, manager is understanding, benefits
Cons: A LOT OF WORK for one person,

Title: "Love the job, love the people, just not my co-workers"
Pros: I love my benefits and payment on my job - I began at $10.55 an hour! Major improvement from everywhere else I've worked started, which all simply started me at minimum wage. Not to mention the benefits and the food are both great. And it's easy to rise up if you're a hard worker. If you want to go beyond being a simple crew member, and you put in the hard work, management will make sure you get the time and tools to do so.
Cons: No downsides come from the company itself. The only problem I have is the people who don't work as hard as they should. My location in particular has met with problems on a regular basis only because there are people that don't show up on a regular basis, many fired due to this. But I guess that's what you get when you work with high school / college students.
Advice to Management: Nothing to say other than keep up the good work guys! Hopefully you'll find some good people actually worth having around soon.

Title: "Everything"
Pros: Time is very flexible for me
Cons: So much work and so little pay.
Advice to Management: Raise salaries because it's really heavy work.

Title: "Best company I've worked for"
Pros: The atmosphere is very friendly, your team members are happy and helpful and the fast paced day to day makes the days go by fast, there is always something to do but it's not tedious or boring.
Cons: It can get very hectic, you'll find yourself with so much to do and not enough time to do it.. but that's something you figure out with time.
Advice to Management: More time for one on one training during time periods that aren't rushed would be amazing.. I found myself teaching myself most of the stuff I learned

Title: "Is it really worth it?"
Pros: Fun place to work at. Very diverse.
Cons: It becomes your life, but fun either way

Title: "General Manager - Great Foundation and Culture"
Pros: I have worked at multiple Chipotle locations. What I have experienced and learned was great. I won't lie, you will work like crazy and they have very high expectations in comparison to other fast food restaurants by far especially since the e coli out break. With that however, If you make it here I am confident you can make it anywhere, you will learn to build a people culture by connecting with others and that is a skill that is useful in life in general. That is Chipotles main focus in their business, to develop their people (borderline selflessness) and through that the numbers (Sales, P&L, Food Safety & Ops Audit, etc.) will improve. It is an awesome fact that a majority of Chipotles GM's came from the bottom, like myself as a Crew member and it has probably the highest paying salary in comparison to other fast food restaurants. With that fact you don't need a bachelors witch is an awesome opportunity for those who cant afford school.
Cons: Chipotle will work you to the bone if you are not organized. As a salary manager you are free labor and unless you rule with an iron fist with a lot of organization you may get sucked into that vortex of being a super crew member. I feel a lot of that is determined by the demographic of people that work for you. the quality of workers in Princeton, NJ by be a better caliber than from Detroit, MI.
Advice to Management: I feel Chipotle should shy away hiring external hires. As of right now I have an area manager that came from a retail store. I feel as though i am teaching him everything and along with that once i do teach him he micro manages me to the T. Micro management is not the problem, it can be useful if you know what you're doing however for some one that is inexperienced in the field and doesn't value the teams opinions then that is when the problem occurs.

Title: "Still has potential to be how great it once was"
Pros:
Good food with a meaning
Supports local farmers and organizations well
Emphasis on promoting from within (besides Team Leader or higher, which is a mistake)
Cons:
Hourly management severely underpaid for expectations given
Compromised its care for employees and management due to food illness outbreak
Doesn't allow any overtime and hourly schedule expectations are difficult to meet due to no designated training hours
Advice to Management: Chipotle as a company handled the food illness outbreak well by implementing a lot of new procedures. Food quality has generally gotten better since the first round of policy changes but we compromised our values due to this scare by not taking care of your employees. It is no secret that not having enough hours available on the schedule is a problem at Chipotle nationwide. There are multiple petitions and Facebook pages appealing to the company due to this issue. I'm a numbers guy so I don't like how many changes there were that were not compensated or explained properly. If sales are down, tell me that the damn sales are down and why new policies will help. Also, do NOT expect a restaurant to be +3 - +5 over staffed as a standard when the company can't come up with 35 hours to give employees of 12 years. Start caring about your employees and management teams again and they will be much more motivated to do more work for the same amount of pay. Lastly, If you're going to trust someone with keys to the store, a safe code, and to open/close the restaurant as the only manager, you need to pay more than $12/hr after three years of loyalty. Especially working at a higher volume restaurant due to the expectations.

Cons: Really bad management. My boss who had been restauranteur of my location for about ten years was randomly fired by the supervisor only to be replaced with a manager that had no idea what she was doing. She hired incompetent people and made no effort in regards to training. She also was constantly having crew members take on responsibilities that the management were meant to be in charge of. Upper management needs to come in and push that restauranteur on each location, as it really encourages a fantastic work environment.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Friendly co-workers. Management worked well with flexible scheduling. Free food while working.
Cons: Prep work was hard to finish on time. Sometimes was made to work off the clock to start Prep work before scheduling.
Advice to Management: Barry Sutter was an awesome GM.

Title: "It Used To Be Better"
Pros: Great crew, and a great atmostphere. Always enjoy working with my coworkers.
Cons:
Deployment times are borderline insane. Lots of pressure to "be a top performer", not all standards are achievable. Lack of common sense.
After E. Coli outbreak the quality of the food has gone down in an effort to make the food "safer".
Wages aren't worth the work.
Advice to Management: Focus on making sure things get done, then cut labor; don't cut hours then complain that things aren't being done. Also, no human on earth can cut 25 lbs of onions in 18 minutes.

Title: "Decent job"
Pros: Staff is really dedicated to the company
Cons:
Pressured workers to work off the clock and during lunch break hours.
Turnover rate was high

Title: "Great Job, sad to leave"
Pros: Great management, fast paced, quick advancement. Went from crew to salary management position in a little over a year. Great company
Cons: Long hours if you are salary, management is somewhat indecisive about what they expect, can take a long time to promote if you have bad luck.
Advice to Management: Keep it up. I had a great time at Chipotle. Maybe a little more oversight for ATLs. Mine was a really great guy but would be there for us some weeks and be unreachable other times.

Title: "Nice!"
Pros: Good work environment, it's fast paced and easy to get into the swing of after a while. This ended up being a good place for me to work part time as a student.
Cons: It's difficult to get used to the pace (especially during that lunch rush), but I had an overall good experience.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros:
A common theme here: free food, but that's about it.

I do believe that the leadership at the corporate level believes in the mission of empowering top performers to achieve high standards, but it's so lost in the day to day operations of the store. Conceptually great, but not being executed.
Cons:
My TL only has 6 stores yet somehow managed to only find his way into our store for 10-15 mins per week. My previous TL was a rockstar prior to her promotion/focus on ShopHouse.

Every min of every day is planned out. You can't breath, forget develop a team. There's NO work life balance regardless or role, or respect for the crew's time/what's scheduled. The schedule is posted, at best, 72 hrs prior to being live which is staggering. It's a great place to work if you have no friends or family or outside interests. It's all or nothing here.
Advice to Management: It'll fall on deaf ears. My advice is to eat here because it is safe and delicious food, just don't work here.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Co-workers are amazing the best people you will ever meet.
Cons: Not an easy job ALWAYS moving!
Advice to Management: Switch positions more often.

Title: "Crew Member Experience"
Pros:
- Very cooperative team and management was great. Managers knew what to do in terms of peak times
- I got a free meal after every shift
- I learned how to deal with customers and work at a very high pressure environment
Cons:
- I was only designated to be there during absolute peak times
- I do not see this job to be fitting for more than a year as promotion is not the best.
Advice to Management: Keep working on that line! You have great management skills in times of great pressure.

Title: "Summer job at Chipotle"
Pros: Chipotle offer a very high pay for a food service job. There are ways to move up within the company if you are able to stick around long enough.
Cons: The work that was demanded was not worth the pay, even though it was relatively high. Working in prep was really really tough.
Advice to Management: Do not start an employee out on prep. It is such a tough and demanding place to start out on. I think all employees should start on line and then move into different roles.

Title: "Strict, but good quality"
Pros: Upholds company standards of cleanliness and food quality
Cons: always busy, less leniency

Title: "Regional Support Specialist"
Pros:
People culture is second to none.
Perks are above average related to industry standard.
Flexibility of schedule and quality of work/life balance.
Cons: Salary may be slightly lower than other companies.

Title: "Excellent place to work with great people!"
Pros: Amazing crew members and values. Unique atmosphere when walking into the restaurant. Provides their crew with everything they need and outstanding customer service.
Cons: Can be extremely busy at times! Not many cons considering that chipotle takes pride in their work ethics and high standards.
Advice to Management: Keep up the great work!

Title: "Literal Hell on Earth."
Pros: Good benefits (I.e 90% of college tuition reimbursement)
Cons: Poor hours, rude customers, terrible management.
Advice to Management: Shape up or sit down

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Great Company their vision is clear and they show it with pride.
Cons: Not too many cons tbh, great food and great service can't complain.

Title: "Cree"
Pros: Fun work place, good benefits
Cons: Never honored days off that were approved before working there due to school.
Advice to Management: Keep your word

Title: "Great Culture"
Pros: Culture, flexible hours, fast paced, free/discounted food
Cons: There were very few downsides. High turnover, difficult customers, no overtime

Title: "Terrible company"
Pros: There were no pros. None at all.
Cons: TERRIBLE MANAGEMENT. TOTAL BUREAUCRACY. TERRIBLE PEOPLE
Advice to Management: Perhaps you guys should start caring about your employees?

Title: "Solid Experience"
Pros: They promote a team atmosphere at Chipotle and subsequently make your job easier. The free food is nice as well.
Cons: Constantly on your feet throughout the duration of your shift. Open early and close late. Big learning curve.
Advice to Management: Offer a break for a 4 hour shift

Title: "Poor Management and Corporate Employees"
Pros: Great pay and hours. Very easy to advance
Cons: Poor management and "leaders" to run this company. This place expects chipotle to be your entire life, with little room to do anything else, i.e. school or another job.
Advice to Management: Grow up & do your job

Title: "Pretty good overall"
Pros: Paid breaks and free food. You get a 50% off when you go to but food but you aren't working.
Cons: Didn't follow child labor laws and made me work past the time I was supposed to and if I complained my hours would be cut down.
Advice to Management: Listen to the employees and lay them equally because some will think it's unfair if others get paid more for the same job.

Title: "Great Company"
Pros: Great part time job, opportunity for advancement, fun culture and good company values
Cons: really busy at lunch hour

Title: "Go work somewhere else"
Pros: Pros of working here are the benefits and the food. (However I was already a chipotle lover before I began to work here, so I got sick of the food already.)
Cons: Employees do way too much work, for the horrible breaks (2 only) and pay that we get. You're pressured to work fast, so if you're too slow, your coworkers will not like you. I had such high expectations for this place, but it's honestly the worst! Very stressful and tiring!
Advice to Management:
Give more breaks!! One 30 min break and one 10 min break is all we have. I recommend at least adding another 10 min break.
The pay is so low, for the amount of work that employees do.
Pick your managers correctly; one of my managers is so unprofessional. Some of my NEWER coworkers far surpass him already. Also, if you're going to hire people, at least make sure that they have the 13 characteristics... many of my coworkers are so lazy and snobby.
I really hate working here. Work somewhere else.

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: Learned how to operate a scaleable restaurant. Good systems in place to move up if you want to.
Cons: Long hours if you have incompetent management. Efficiency and common sense come second place to doing things the "Chipotle Way". Being on the grill in a busy location is hell.

Title: "hated it"
Pros:
great co-workers
free meal every shift
good opportunity for growth in the company
Cons:
Inconsistent Expectations
Fast track to management leaves people unprepared
Expect you to be a top performer from day 1 with no learning curve. Very little patience.
Never acknowledged for good work, only for mistakes.
Advice to Management:
Better communication between managers, please. One day I was told I was doing great by one manager only to be pulled aside the next day by another to be told I should be fired due to my "consistently poor performance". Which is it? It can't be both.
Also, please actually DO the performance reviews. I had no idea how I was actually doing because the manager never gave me a formal review. How can someone improve if they have no idea where they stand?

Title: "Loved the team"
Pros: Amazing team of people, they really do hire based on the 13 key characteristics. Realistic opportunities for advancement.
Cons: It's hard work, it was a rewarding experience but every day you come home sore and smelling like peppers. Unless you like that sort of thing.
Advice to Management: Continue doing an amazing job, oh and cut the pm prep guys some slack, especially in high volume locations.

Title: "Good Vibes"
Pros: Chipotle typically hires young people which keeps the atmosphere young and fresh. You don't need any experience to get hired, they train you and pay you for it. Paid breaks and free employee meal if you're on the clock but 50% off if you're not. They're super flexible with schedules so they will always cater to your needs. Overall, definitely a great place for a first job to pickup experience.
Cons: Sometimes they expect things to get done in an unreasonable amount of time. Low pay for the amount of work you do, especially if you work in the kitchen.
Advice to Management: Give better pay!

Title: "Crappy Crew"
Pros:
Nice coworkers, especially in crew
Customers are usually friendly enough
Free meals
Cons:
Poorly Managed
Lack of Leadership
Expect Crew to do everything
Managers would just be on their phone all the time
Would give schedule Sunday
Advice to Management: start working more, not just sitting in the office on your phone

Title: "Bittersweet but worth it in the long run"
Pros:
Great work environment
Great starting pay
Easy work
Can easily become manager in under a year
Cons:
Management (depending on location)
Scheduling conflicts
Age gaps (not recommended for people over 30)
Advice to Management: As much as I enjoy working for the company, there are many things that need to change as far as the work environment. There also needs to be more prerequisites for who should become a manager.

Title: "Working for Chipotle"
Pros:
- A great opportunity to broaden communication skills and culinary skills.
- Close knit staff.
Cons:
- Can be overwhelming.
- Varying hours.
Advice to Management:
- Get to know and build a better relationship with your employees.
- Lead by example.

Title: "chipotle is an okay job"
Pros: free chipotle , 50% off your second meal , 30 minute lunch breaks
Cons: cant take tips , there was a lot of favoritism
Advice to Management: stop it with the favoritism

Title: "Good company to work at"
Pros: People were really nice, managers were strict but in a good way, helped me grow a lot as an employee
Cons: No benefits, pay was a little below what I expected

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Offer good starting wage, does reviews for raises very often, everyone is really nice, the training was done very well at that location
Cons: management did not really address issues as well as they could have at times, you have to be very fast paced and able to multi-task
Advice to Management: I'm sure at other locations it's different but this location had an issue with resolving issues as well as they should.

Title: "More than a Fast Food Restaurant"
Pros:
Company stayed committed to their values, culture, and vision.
Co-workers had fun and were motivated to be empowered
Cons: District manager, also known as Apprentice Team Leader was an extreme jerk that contributed to three managers, including the GM, resigning their position.
Advice to Management: Keep it up! Empower your team, don't discourage them!

Title: "Great"
Pros: Great Company if you find yourself at a great store. Good work benefits to both full-time and part-time employees.
Cons: I have had my share of working at bad stores and they are bad. Sometimes managers unwilling to help/put in a good work. Various "low performing" employees bring down moral.

Title: "Chiptole"
Pros: Great people, great connections. I've made lifelong friends working at the store
Cons: Sometimes managers string out employees thin, especially during rush

Title: "Goals and Team"
Pros: You get a checklist to work from to advance your skills, rotate on tasks regularly and get a healthy break.
Cons: Pay is mediocre at best and safety training on grill and fryer are minimal.
Advice to Management: Focus more on training for more opportunities.

Title: "Gm"
Pros: Great food great people it's pretty awesome working for this company don't trust the upper management as a GM they always want to fire someone
Cons: The upper management was bogus always wanted me to fire someone for no reason they have really bad people skills
Advice to Management: Don't be tricked in not being a top performer they will tell you anything to make you feel like your not doing a great job

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: working as a team is great
Cons: when it gets busy, it stinks

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: Great, fun environment. Lots of opportunity for development. Lots of knowledge and builds a string work ethic for those with little job experience.
Cons: Long days sometimes, high turnover rate. Minimum age for hire is 16 so some maturity issues from time to time.
Advice to Management: Just openly communicate with you people and don't allow employees to work.off the clock. Not only is it illegal, but it isn't very encouraging.

Title: "Great working environment"
Pros: for starters free food is always a positive. when I worked there the working environment was great, the managers do try their best to create an environment where you feel empowered. they are also flexible on hours, just speak to the manager and they try their best to accommodate your circumstance
Cons: it is a physically exhausting job. you are often given several tasks at once and they need to be done efficiently and most importantly done quickly which can overwhelm you.
Advice to Management: nothing really comes to mind.

Title: "It was alright."
Pros: You received free food. Some of the workers were nice, and often times the tips were okay. Other than that there is nothing else to the job.
Cons: The fact that you had to memorize the Chipotle vision and would get in trouble and or passed up for opportunities to grow was ridiculous.

Title: "Not awesome, but not terrible."
Pros: You can have a laugh with both customers and your fellow employees while serving great food. Great for people who like fast paced environments. Great if your a college student. Free Food (50% off when not working).
Cons: Management. Although some problems have been mitigated, problems such as constant changes to the schedule and people not getting time off requests honored stick around. GM constantly micromanages. People give you a hard time because of the EColi breakout last year TO THIS DAY. Closing can be tiring, especially when SSR (Food Safety people) rolls into town. Understaffed a lot (Managers>Crew)
Advice to Management: Focus more on managerial work rather than micromanaging employees with anything to their work, life, etc. Also, give your SMs and Apprentice a chance to share their opinions rather than making decisions without checking with them. Prep shouldn't be given a hard time as often, their job is tough.

Title: "Crew Memeber"
Pros: Benefits, Teamwork, Helping others, Talking to Customers, Opportunity
Cons: If you are not a fast worker, you will be behind when the store is PACKED.
Advice to Management: None, they do it right.

Title: "Sucks!!"
Pros:
Free food
Short shifts
Fast paced
Cons:
Lack of hours
Cleaning the entire front of store alone

Title: "fired for nothing"
Pros: They hours they gave were okay
Cons: Horrible service .. They treated employees like trash
Advice to Management: Don't fire great workers

Title: "A good company to work for but only if you like busting yourself for a dollar above minimum pay"
Pros: Higher hourly wage, advancement opportunities, flexible hours, frequently corporate involvement
Cons: Too much work, very tiring and stressful, new burns and cuts everyday, will hate working here in the start

Title: "Learned to be a Leader"
Pros: Developing leadership skills has been a lesson I will carry on for the rest of my career in the food service industry. And then being able to teach is the most rewarding part of this job.
Cons: Better work/like balance would be great. But worth every minute I'm there.

Title: "Meh"
Pros: It had great food and good opportunity to meet new people and open up to new adventurs
Cons: Sometimes would be petty employees and the manager wouldn't readily help when we hAd questions
Advice to Management: Be open to helping more because it was hard for me to be around a manager who wasnt open to helping

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros:
-Chipotle really pushes to make sure they have employees who care about the quality of food and services they produce.
-You learn a lot about how to work as a team and how to effectively manage a team.
-Tuition reimbursement after a year of working
-Free food on the job
-50% off when not working
Cons:
-fast pace environment
-You take on the role of whatever they need at the time

Title: "Great to kill time, but is it really worth it?"
Pros: Free food, 30 Min paid break, awesome crew members
Cons: Too much work for the pay, the amount of hours given too your were not negotiable. Sometime you would have to put in overtime. It would put stress onto your body. Not recommend for students
Advice to Management: Please be flexible with the crew member when it comes to certain events

Title: "Team Member"
Pros: Friendly, hard working people; fun manager
Cons: It's a lot harder than it looks

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Very good management and lots of room to grow. Promote from within. Works very well with school schedules.
Cons: Can be a little too much work for amount compensated.

Title: "Decent pay....horrible management"
Pros: Working at Chipotle pushes you to work hard, the pay and hours are pretty good as a college student. Oh and great customers too
Cons: If you have issues with internal management you may be fired depending on the persons seniority.
Advice to Management: Get rid of the "bad seeds" (general managers and shift leaders)

Title: "Cool but Culty"
Pros: Everyone was really cool, pay was decent, flexible with hours so I could manage school and work.
Cons: Basically a cult with all the top performer crap. Expected really hard work out of everybody but didn't enforce it for the favorites of the store.
Advice to Management: Throw this top performer crap out the garbage and treat your employees well. When a restaurant makes restaurateur, reward everyone, not just the GM.

Title: "Management skill was lacking"
Pros: Free or discounted food, fun environment, and nice coworkers!
Cons: Manager did not realize that I was a student--gave me unrealistic hour expectations
Advice to Management: Make sure you know if someone is quitting and when to hire new employees, so the current employees don't have to make up for the missing hands.

Title: "Kitchen manager"
Pros: Good pay. Free food. Laid back atmosphere.
Cons: Over worked. Under valued. Lots of back breaking work.
Advice to Management: Have enough employees so we don't have to do the work of multiple people.

Title: "Pretty Good"
Pros:
Honestly, for 9.50/hr just starting in Brooklyn is pretty great. I was a student and with limited experience this was the best paying job.
They are super flexible on what hours you can/can't work. They worked around my school schedule and when I got a second job for the winter, they worked around that as well.
Cons:
It's a bit all over the place. You're never going to be assigned to one place for a long time.
No real training, they just throw you in and expect you to get everything

Title: "Not Bad"
Pros: In the east Pembroke pines location great management worked with my schedule very well ... great people to work with
Cons: REALLY hard work fast paced , always have to be doing something
Advice to Management: GREAT JOB

Title: "Prep Chef"
Pros: Developed my knife skills and speed
Cons: Because business is slow not getting the hours I want (forty hours or more)
Advice to Management: I'm passionate, driven and focused. Would welcome a change and have visited your store and have met your inspiring staff would love to be a part of that team.

Title: "A Love, Hate Relationship"
Pros: Many Benefits, Great Culture, Awesome People (Overall), Growth Opportunity
Cons: False Promises, Upper Management Plays Favorites, People Form Into Clicks
Advice to Management: KEEP YOUR WORD! If you say you're going to do something, do it. It's that simple.

Title: "Great job, enhanced by who you work with"
Pros:
There are a lot of pros to working at Chipotle in my experience here!
Pay is amazing to start with.
30 min breaks when you work 5+ hours, 15 min when you work <5 hours.
Of course, there is one free meal per shift. You also get 50% off your meal when you aren't working - but only at the location you work at, which is kind of lame, because you're still part of the company anywhere you go...
The work is fast-paced so you're never sitting around bored. There is always something you can be doing.
You get to keep tips! This is my first job and I was confused when other people told me at their job they couldn't keep tips?! Well you can here. And you make a lot of them usually.
Very very accommodating with the hours you want and the days you need off. I have never had a problem, ever - then again, I am very reliable so they are perhaps more lenient with me.
The higher-ups come to talk to us now and then and are personal with us.
My coworkers are amazing, I hang out with some of them outside of work and have them on Snapchat haha. Even my managers are incredibly chill but dedicated, everything makes for a great environment.
Most of your customers are happy campers.
Managers are genuinely interested in my personal life in a nice way.Talk to you like a friend and not someone below themselves.
Cons:
If you don't work with positive people who get along, which I guess happens at the other Chipotle's my friends work at, it can be a grueling job. You have so much communication constantly going on - don't expect to not get to know your coworkers, it's impossible not to with the amount of talking you have to do with each other. Just make sure the people who work there seem like they get along and a group you want to be a part of!
Can get cliquey but I think that is like every job. Nothing incredibly noticeable, but age differences are sometimes weird within the company and people sector off. Expected.
Sometimes they give inadequate training. A few times I've been thrown on cash even though I've never been trained on it...it wasn't hard per se but still, I should've probably been given some guidance. Lots of other people feel they have received inadequate training as well, but we can all do our job.
We seem to ALWAYS be hiring...that's fine, but sometimes I feel like some people we hire should not have been hired, and when I interview them I say that to the managers...they get hired anyways, and they of course still aren't stellar. But they can do their job.
Advice to Management: Make sure everybody receives adequate training. I know people who have become overwhelmed and flustered due to lack of training. And other times people think they're trained, but they do something very wrong and then it's a bit too late.

Title: "Good job but"
Pros: This is a great job with a lot of room to grow and become a manager fast if you're good.
Cons: Very stressful and can really drain you sometimes you just have to keep your head up and work with your team.
Advice to Management: Give people a break sometimes it's not an easy job and it can take its toll on people

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Fun environment to work in with people
Cons: A lot of hours and work

Title: "R"
Pros: Promotions from within, free food
Cons: Long hours, work life balance

Title: "Don't listen to the hype"
Pros: Interesting coworkers. Free meal with every shift. 50% off meals if you've already had your employee meal. Plus you learn how to make some killer guac
Cons: You'll have to work off the clock. If you don't hit your break in time you don't get a break. If you're not happy enough they fire you. Without warning. They promise promotions to 3 people at once and turn them against each other.
Advice to Management: Communicate. Honestly. Stop promising promotions. Y'all act like you're trying to change fast food then turn around and pull the same McDonald's BS you find everywhere else. Don't blame your crew members for you setting them up for failure. Ditch the "no excuses" attitude. Oh yeah, and don't fire people for being mentally ill.

Title: "Very comfortable working space"
Pros: College loans and good pay
Cons: Gets very busy, very hot
Advice to Management: Keep doing what your doing

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Great vibe and people. Learn the reason they are in business and food is great. Really fresh. My management were really open to my schedule while i was at school.
Cons: Pay isnt the best for the amount of work you do. Needs to have more incentives to keep employees or a lot of turnover and not enough employees because of long interview process.
Advice to Management: Keep improving employees and have them move around instead of just keeping them in one place.

Title: "Chipotle Review"
Pros: No experience is required to work at Chipotle, it doesn't take long to become familiar with the restaurant's mission and responsibilities of the job
Cons: Poor management, at my specific location the entire team had only been there less than a year besides the managers, schedule was too frequently changed w/o much of a notice
Advice to Management: Improve policies for workers and keep schedules consistent to be considerate of workers. Also, be more selective in the hire process to obtain substantial and long term employees.

Title: "If you want to build yourself up."
Pros: If you have no experience, you can build path with Chipotle. They're all about training their employees who started with nothing, all it takes is effort. Great environment to work in.
Cons: A main con I would say about the company is that they have really high expectations of high performers, and if you don't meet that expectation, you are considered a low performer, which is really demotivating.

Title: "Cashier review"
Pros: Positive environment. Empowerment by crew member and through the managers. Free food when you work is the biggest plus at chipotle. Making fresh food is rewarding as well.
Cons: It's a very demanding job when it comes to customer needs and wants. We try to give fast food a different name when people walk into chipotle, but we are very well underplayed for the amount of labor we do.
Advice to Management: I believe the minimum wage for chipotle needs to be raised honestly. I don't feel like we get paid enough for the amount of work we do for the restaurant. We are a very reliable and dependable crew and as well as high standards are always in our best interest. Chipotle is not just another job it's an investment and a great work environment therefore I think the employees at chipotle should be considered more valuable than most food places.

Title: "crew"
Pros: friendly, family atmosphere. free food, good benefits
Cons: lack of organization management, communication skills, hardwork for low pay, time management is terrible.
Advice to Management: train the managers

Title: "It's been an ok experience at Chipotle but there's alot of room for improvement"
Pros: Great work environment, friendly staff, no previous experienced required to work here,free lunch and great food!
Cons: Extremely fast paced work most times, work schedules can get a little hectic, when it's slow workers get sent home earlier without compensation on missing hours,work hours may vary, wages need to be a little higher, you're always expected to work faster, kitchen and dish washer need to be better equipped for workers by providing better safety items such as heavy duty rubber gloves to wash dishes and insulated gloves to prevent burns in the kitchen. Also, a emergency eye wash area would be appropriate.
Advice to Management: Appreciate your workers a little more especially those that have worked at Chipotle for quite a while. If possible offer them a raise, because they work very hard for you everyday. Its hard work!

Title: "Chipotle Corporate"
Pros: Wear what you what to work, fun people to work with, flexible workplace, exposure to many sides of the company, work-life balance is encouraged, good bonus (when the stock price is doing well), and free burritos!
Cons: Vague standards for a promotion, high turnover rate, hard to know where you stand with management, cutthroat environment, review techniques are not well done, positive reinforcement is a concept that is mythical at the company, gossip-filled work place from the director down, pay does not match occupation, not much vacation time, overall toxic workplace at times.

Title: "It was amazing."
Pros: I worked with amazing coworkers who made me look forward to going to work everyday. I had an awesome GM who understood and validated each and everyone of his employees. Overall, I felt it wasn't a job; it was a second home.
Cons: I really can't think of any cons working for Chipotle.

Title: "Ehhh"
Pros: Fast work environment, promotion opportunities, decent pay in low cost of living areas
Cons: Poor poor management, the opportunities aren't really that plentiful and you have to kill yourself to get them
Advice to Management: Not everything is about you, when you don't help your employees they leave, imagine that

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: Good work enviornment with a very upbeat atmosphere. Management was very helpful and would reward hard workers.
Cons: Chipotle being a restaurant that gets completely backed up during lunch and dinner it can get very exhausting.

Title: "It was good for the time being until your not good enough"
Pros: Free food, raise every 6 months
Cons: You get treated like a peasant she you font do things this not good enough for the managers, they go by top performer and low performer. The managers are kids with no experience and big egos.
Advice to Management: DON'T PUT CHILDREN IN MANAGEMENT!!

Title: "Depends on your management team"
Pros: Starts out above minimum wage with opportunity to grow with the company if you're serious about it. Cool environment if you have a good team.
Cons: Management can be a pain sometimes if you don't have the support that you need. Not much compensation for moving up the ladder. Work/Life balance starts to suck anywhere beyond crew.
Advice to Management: Care about your managers personal life. Don't be selfish all the time. Treat others as people and not dollar signs.

Title: "Free Burritos"
Pros: You get free burritos great success
Cons: Long hours of standing and hustling
Advice to Management: let me leave early and still get paid the same amount

Title: "If you're looking for lots of stress and no work/life balance, this is the place for you!"
Pros:
- Corporate employees get $100 in free Chipotle every month.
- Casual office environment and no dress code. You can literally wear your bathrobe to work if you wanted to.
- Annual teambuilding trips (i.e. Las Vegas, Chicago, Denver)
- Free chips and Salsa every Thursday.
- Benefits are ok and comparable to what’s being offered at other companies.
- Sabbatical offered after every 10 years of employment.
Cons:
- No work/life balance. Literally, zero. The store managers are expected to work a minimum of 50 hours each week; it’s the same type of mentality in the corporate office. Very lean workforce. This would be a very difficult place to work if you have small children and it would be virtually impossible if you happened to be a single parent.

- You’ll work primarily with entry level college students who lack work experience. There’s something to be said for bringing in new and fresh ideas but if you’re over 25, you probably aren’t going to be hired. The office has a very juvenile, high school feel to it.

- Not many advancement opportunities within the Columbus office unless you’re willing to move to the Denver HQ.

- The company is very focused on their vision of “being top performers empowered to achieve high standards.” This sentence will be stuffed down your throat from day one and you will hear it ALL THE TIME. What they mean by this is that "just" doing your job and excelling at it is not enough to receive an above average review at the end of the year. In fact, it’s the equivalent to being one step away from being fired. In order to be considered a “Top Performer”, you not only have to excel at your job but you also have to come up with projects and efficiencies that will save the company massive amounts of time and money. You likely won’t have time to work on these projects during the day so this is one of the things you’d need to work overtime for.

- The company offers paid holidays but you’ll only have the day off if the workload allows. When I was there, we worked from home part of the day on Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve and Christmas and we worked in the office on Memorial Day and Labor Day. This will vary by department.

- Pay is very low when compared to the extremely high expectations that they have.

- Paid time off is not competitve when compared to other companies.
Advice to Management: The officers really need to take a closer look at the Columbus Accounting Center and examine why the turnover rate is so high in a corporate setting.

Cons: Other than a lengthy hiring process, I don't think there are any cons to this company.
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work! Chipotle is a great company that's been expanding like crazy for the past few years and I think there's a solid reason for that that starts with its employees and its mission.

Title: "Great if there is nothing else going on for you"
Pros: Best part about Chipotle is the amount of knowledge and training provided to you. There is no hierarchy, and everyone is expected to treat the business like it's theirs. I learned so much about running a business, being a part of an amazing "family" of a team, and the opportunity is almost limitless. You work really hard and enjoy a great atmosphere if you're under the right management. Also, you have good benefits and tuition reimbursment
Cons: Chipotle is a lot of hard work. I've worked for quite a few restaurants and no matter what anyone says, Chipotle will be the hardest job you've ever had. A lot of working off the clock is expected of you. And lately, Chipotle is changing what's important to them. They cant handle the amount of growth and are losing their culture. It used to be all about the employees and creating an amazing culture, but now more and more people are being hired from the outside and it's becoming all about the numbers. They don't even do a lot of fresh prep in house anymore. I've also seen too many people work 80+ hours a week, be rushed into positions they aren't prepared for, and then be fired. Chipotle does not have their heart in the right place these days, which is why I left.
Advice to Management: Stick to the core values of this company. The numbers were doing fine when that was the focus. Now it's just becoming another chain. Believe in the 13, or go somewhere else. Stop ruining the vision and only caring about yourselves. #ThePepperTillDeath
